meanings.definition: The hard covering on the foot of an animal, such as a horse or cow.
meanings.sent1: The horse's hoof made a loud sound on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The cow's hoof left imprints in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The hoof of the horse seemed to have a mind of its own, tapping impatiently.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a hoof, steady and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The black hoof of the cow stood out against the green pasture.

meanings.definition: To strike or trample with the foot.
meanings.sent1: He had to hoof the door to get it open.
meanings.sent2: The horse hoofs the ground when it is agitated.
meanings.sent3: She playfully hoofs at the fallen leaves, pretending they are enemies.
meanings.sent4: The soccer player hoofs the ball towards the goal with all his might.
meanings.sent5: The hiker had to hoof through the thick mud to reach the summit.
